description.narrative: To improve capacity of the Government of Lao to meet the challenges of the 8th NSEDP implementation and monitoring, formulation of 9th NSEDP eventually leading up to LDC graduation, MIC transition, and SDG achievement.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

receiver-org.narrative: Government of Lao People's Democratic Republ
Government of Lao People's Democratic Republ
Government of Lao People's Democratic Republ
Government of Lao People's Democratic Republ

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: 1.1.1 Availability of the national institutional mechanism for systematic capacity building of line ministries and the provincial governments on basic Results-based Management (RBM) concepts, focusing on results-based planning. 1.1.2 Number of line ministries and provincial governments that have increased knowledge of basic Results-based Management (RBM) and fully adopted results-based planning, monitoring and reporting. 1.1.3 Number of line ministries and provincial governments with increased knowledge of Medium Term Expenditure Framework (MTEF) concepts. 1.2.1 Availability of the national institutional mechanism for systematic capacity building of line ministries and the provincial governments on basic Results-based Management (RBM) concepts, focusing on results-based planning. 1.2.2 Extent to which policies, systems and/or institutional measures are in place at the national and sub-national levels to generate and strengthen gender-sensitive employment and livelihoods (UNDP Strategic Plan Output Indicator 1.1.2). 2.1.1 Transition to the post-2020 Lao Development Forum that is fully consulted and officially adopted in line with the Vientiane Partnership Declaration (2016-2025). 2.1.2 Progress in implementation of the Vientiane Partnership Declaration Country Action Plan (2016-2025), in %. 2.2.1 Extent to which annual Round Table (Implementation) Meetings result in clear and measurable outcomes and indicators in the spirit of the Vientiane Partnership Declaration (2016-2025). 2.2.2 % of the Round Table process outcomes and indicators implemented through the Sector Working Groups and other relevant mechanisms. 3.1.1 Availability of a national roadmap for the achievement of SDGs by 2030 with costed Annual Work Plans and their implementation progress. 3.1.2 Extent to which the SDG Secretariat is able to coordinate information sharing, dialogue, engagement and cooperation on SDGs among the Government ministries/agencies, Development Partners,

comment.narrative: 1.1.1 There is no systematic training on RBM. 1.1.2 0 1.1.3 0 1.2.1 1 - not adequately 1.2.2 2 – very partially, there has been a national policy debate and an agenda for change agreed for policies, systems and institutional measures at the national or sub-national levels to generate and strengthen employment and livelihoods. 2.1.1 In its current form, the RTP is successful but will become increasingly irrelevant post-2020. 2.1.2 VD-CAP II is developed. 2.2.1 1 – not adequately; the outcomes are articulated without indicators to measure progress. 2.2.2 RTMs have stated outcomes but not systematically applied and followed up on. 3.1.1 The Prime Minister issued a decision on establishment of the National Steering Committee on SDGs under his leadership; 3.1.2 The Prime Minister issued a decision on establishment of the National Steering Committee on SDGs under his leadership; 3.2.1 1 - not adequately, general familiarity with the SDG indicators & targets exists but not on the way how to achieve them. 3.2.2 60% of 8th NSEDP indicators are linked to the SDGs, including those linked to LDC graduation. No linkage to the sectoral strategies done yet. 4.1.1 1 – not adequate, LaoInfo functions reasonably well but needs further improvements and strengthening; no metadata is publicly available; horizontal exchange of data among ministries is limited; information disaggregation needs improvement. 4.1.2 LSB with the assistance from PARIS21 conducted Mid-Term Review of the Strategy 4.1.3 LSB data are used by other ministries for planning and monitoring policy implementation, however data accessibility and sharing needs improvement. 4.2.1 The 5th NDHR on LDC graduation is prepared and launched. 4.2.2 The 5th NDHR on LDC graduation is prepared and launched; The SDG Baseline Report is under preparation.

1.1.1 The training curriculum is prepared and the national resource group conducted the first two trial trainings. 1.1.2 RBM training plan and arrangement for its implementation (at least 1 line ministry and 2 provinces with the assessment rate ≥ 4). 1.1.3 MTEF training plan and arrangement for its implementation (at least 1 line ministry and 2 provinces with the assessment rate ≥ 4). 1.2.1 Partially, national and provincial work plans on 8th NSEDP achievements are monitored and reported based on Results-Based Management Principles. 1.2.2 4 – largely, change in policies, systems and/or institutional measures has occurred and is being demonstrably implemented at the national and sub-national levels aimed at generating and strengthening gender-sensitive employment and livelihoods. 2.1.1 The 2021 Lao Development Forum is conducted as a policy dialogue focusing on key development issues (beyond NSEDP) and resulting in a specific, measurable, attainable, realistic and time bound follow-up Action Plan involving the SWGs (with Government, DPs, civil society and private sector) in its implementation. 2.1.2 50% of VD-CAP II is implemented. 2.2.1 Largely, measurable outcomes and indicators are set reflecting all relevant recommendations of line ministries, DPs, civil society and private sector 2.2.2 N/A 3.1.1 A costed 2021 Action Plan of the National SDG Roadmap is up to date, approved and implemented through sectoral strategies/work plans and other mechanisms. 3.1.2 Largely, the SDG Secretariat is well functioning with regular coordination and monitoring of the Annual Work Plan of the SDG Roadmap in a consultative and transparent manner, ensuring active flow of information, dialogue, better coordination and a stronger ownership among stakeholders. 3.2.1 ≥3 more than partial level of understanding is achieved through implementation of the communication and training strategy. Large level of understanding is achieved through systematic communication and training. Authorities at all levels are able to contribute to the National SDG Roadmap implementation. 3.2.2 ≥3 more than partially, sectoral strategies/work plans both at central and provincial levels more than partially incorporate the SDG targets and are formally approved with financial strategy, contributing to implementation of the National SDG Roadmap with the preparation of the 9th NSEDP. 4.1.1 3 – partially, LSB is on track in implementing its Action Plan and the LaoInfo Dashboard provide an up-to-date for the 8th NSEDP Midterm Review and any revision of the SDG targets with disaggregation on key target groups and areas, and a possibility to generate metadata. 4.1.2 80% of SDNSS 2016-2025 is implemented. 4.1.3 ≥3 - partially. 4.2.1 40% of NHDR recommendations feed into the policy acts/sectoral programmes/ legislation, targeting LDC graduation; the 6th NHDR is prepared. 4.2.2 10

1.1.1 RBM related activities were put on hold due to limited resources. 1.1.2 RBM related activities were put on hold due to limited resources. 1.1.3 No achievement has been made so far due to lack of funding. 1.2.1 In 2021, with the support of the programme and other relevant partners, efforts were placed on the preparation of the 9th NSEDP implementation arrangement including the M&E framework with costing estimates and financing strategy. The draft documents have been developed and shared with all partners during the pre-consultations and the actual 13th HL-RTM itself for information and further comments. These documents are expected to be finalised in 2022. 1.2.2 Although promotion of female involvement in NSEDP formulation has been done through relevant training/workshops conducted for female officials on the NSEDP formulation including green growth integration, no specific activities were planned and carried out during the course of the programme due to funding shortfall. 2.1.1 No discussions over the transition to the Lao Development Forum (LDF) throughout the course of the programme as this subject to the LDC graduation. 2.1.2 At this stage, a Midterm Desk Review for the VDCAP implementation was carried out with aims to summarize the achievements and the lessons learnt since the adoption of the Declaration in 2015. The primary purpose of the review is to reflect on the successes and challenges during the last five years (2016-2020) within the framework of the 8th NSEDP in order to identify what need to be done for further enhancing effective development cooperation in the country in light of the implementation of the 9th NSEDP (2021-2025). The key findings for the review are based on various monitoring and survey reports produced during the course of implementation, including the 2019 global survey on effective development cooperation, 2019 mutual accountability survey, and other relevant reports. 2.2.1 The 13th HL-RTM and its leading up activities including the pre-consultations/ side events were organized fully online during October and November 2021 with successful outcomes. The key recommendations of the HL-RTM are currently being translated into Prime Minister’s instructions which will be issued to line ministries, provinces and partners very soon for further implementation. 2.2.2 The PM’s instructions on the implementation of the RTIMs/ RTMs outcomes and key recommendations and a detailed follow-up action matrix linked to 8th and 9th NSEDP M&E frameworks were developed and disseminated at national, sectoral and provincial levels. In practice, the outcomes of each RTIM/RTM were shared and consulted with the SWGs through a number of consultation meetings such as SWG Chair and Co-Chair Meetings, SWG Secretariat Meetings, as well as SWG executive and technical level meetings organized on a regular basis. These meetings aimed to discuss the progress of RTM key recommendation implementation apart from other sectoral issues. 3.1.1 After two years of progress, the Government formally adopted the 238 SDG indicators (SDGi) which were categorized into three types as follows: 1) Same as global SDGi (104) referring to adapting the exact global SDG indicator, albeit with some differences in the data disaggregation requirements; 2) Adapted SDGi (61) referring to the proxy indicator with similar requirements to the global SDG indicator that can still respond to the SDG target requirements; and 3) Additional SDGi (73) referring to the new indicator that is not similar to the global SDG indicators. Thus far, the SDG roadmap and 238 SDG indicators (SDGi) were formally endorsed by the Government, and all of these SDGI have been assigned, as relevant, to all nineteen different line ministries and equivalent through a consultation process. To ensure greater coordination among all relevant stakeholders, SDG coordination matrix has been developed to help stronger coordination work across national stakeholders and this will also contribute to advocacy work as appropriate in the long run. 3.1.2 Largely. The National SDG Secretariat has been the driving force to coordinate with the SDG focal points of line ministries and development partners including private sector, civil society, general public and other relevant stakeholders in order to prepare and finalise the national SDG Roadmap and indicators, the SDG communications plan, the first and second VNRs, SDG mobile application, and other SDG promotional materials, etc. 3.2.1 The Government officials and almost all partners have been fully engaged in the SDG localisation process, and the SDG related materials prepared by the SDG secretariat have also been disseminated at national, sectoral and provincial levels. In particular, the SDG roadmap, SDG communications plan, first VNR, SDG mobile application, and other of the advocacy materials were shared with Government agencies/line ministries and development partners as well as other private sector and civil society for feedback and further engagement through a number of SDG stakeholder engagement meetings. However, due to limited funding, trainings and dissemination workshops with provinces were not prioritized in 2020. This was addressed in 2021 particularly within the context of the follow up actions from the first SDG VNR and dissemination of the second VNR in which the Government just presented at the HLPF in July 2021. 3.2.2 ≥3 more than partially, the SDG Metadata Handbook for Lao PDR is being developed by the Secretariat to facilitate not only the monitoring and reporting on the SDGs implementation budget also the SDGs’ integration into the sectoral strategies and plans. 4.1.1 3- partially. Efforts were put on the harmonization of all databases and other relevant platforms to ensure online LaoInfo dashboard is set up at LSB that could be linked with those of line ministries and provinces. With the support of the programme, the consultant team (national and international) has been recruited to help conduct an independent, credible and forward-looking review of the existing systems, as well as providing necessary training/ workshops for colleagues at LSB, line ministries and provinces. 4.1.2 No data 4.1.3 ≥3 - partially. Capacity of statistical officials working at the LSB has been strengthened through training and consultation meeting on uploading sets of data and information onto the National Statistic System of LSB, as well as on consolidation and integration of SDG indicators in the Yearly Statistics Book. 4.2.1 No data 4.2.2 No data

1.1.1 The training curriculum is prepared and the National Resource Group conducted the first two trail training. 1.1.2 RBM training plan and arrangement for its implementation (at least 1 line ministry and 2 provinces with the assessment rate ≥ 4). 1.1.3 TEF training plan and arrangement for its implementation (at least 1 line ministry and 2 provinces with the assessment rate ≥ 4) 1.1.4 partially, national and provincial work plans on 8th NSEDP achievement are monitored and reported based on Results-Based Management Principles. 1.2.1 largely, a change in policies, systems and/or institutional measures has occurred and is being demonstrably implemented at the national and sub-national levels aimed at generating and strengthening gender-sensitive employment and livelihoods. 2.1.1 40% of VD-CAP II is implemented. 2.2.1 largely, measural outcomes and indicators are set reflecting all relevant recommendations of line ministries, DPs, civil society and private sector. 2.2.2 90 % (RTIM outcomes and indicators are properly monitored and reported against through SWGs and other relevant mechanisms). 3.1.1 A costed 2019 Action Plan of the National SDG Roadmap is up to date, approved and implemented through sectoral strategies/work plans and other mechanisms (as appropriate). 3.1.2 largely, the SDG Secretariat is well functioning with regular coordination and monitoring of the Annual Work Plan of the SDG Roadmap in a consultatiive and transparent manner, ensuring active flow of information, dialogue, better coordination and stronger ownership among stakeholders. 3.2.1 ≥3 - more than partial level of understanding is achieved through implementation of the communication and training strategy. 3.2.2 ≥3 - more than partially, sectoral strategies/work plans both at central and provincial levels more than partially incorporate the SDG targets and are formally approved with financial strategy, contributing to implementation of the National SDG Roadmap with the preparation of the 9th NSEDP. 4.1.1 partially, LSB is on track in implementing its Action Plan and the LaoInfo Dashboard provides an up-to-date for the 8th NSEDP mid-term review and any revision of the SDG targets with disaggregation on key target groups and areas and a possibility to generate metadata. 4.1.2 80% of SDNSS 2016-2025 is implemented. 4.1.3 Partially, The level of satisfaction of the national/sub-national authorities and DPs with the quality of statistical products and their accessibility. 4.2.1 40% of NHDR recommendations feed into the policy acts/sectoral programmes/legislation, targeting LDC graduation; the 6th NHDR is prepared. 4.2.2 Cumulatively at least 10 high quality studies/research products/policy briefs are produced, filling the data gap for the 8th NSEDP/SDG targets monitoring and preparation for the next NHDR. 5.1.1 Unqualified audit report. 5.1.2 95% delivery rate and effective implemetation of communication strategy and capacity development plan. 5.1.3 Funding gap - 70% and third party cost sharing - 20% (mean for achieving these targets - Effective implementation of resource mobilisation strategy).

1.1.1. Not implemented because of the focus on NSEDP in 2020 1.1.2. Not implemented because of the focus on NSEDP in 2020 1.1.3. No achievement was made due to lack of funding 1.2.1. Partially achieved. Mid-Term Review of the 8th NSEDP (2016-2020) carried out in 2018 provided a platform for better understanding of relevant partners. The results were used in the formulation of the 9th NSEDP 1.2.2. No achievement was made due to lack of funding 2.1.2. seven (7) out of fourteen (14) VDCAP indicators have been monitored but no quantitative data was published yet 2.2.1. partially – the round table process provided the platform to address the current issues. All key recommendations have been translated into the Prime Minister’s Instruction to line ministries, provinces and partners to ensure the implementation. 2.2.2. 90% - the round table process provided the platform to address the current issues. All key recommendations have been translated into the Prime Minister’s Instruction to line ministries, provinces and partners to ensure the implementation. 3.1.1. Completed. The national SDG roadmap was endorsed by the Prime Minister of Lao PDR during the National SDG Steering Committee Meeting in June 2019, and it has been disseminated to all partners at all levels in 2020. 3.1.2. Largely achieved. The National SDG Secretariat has been the driving force to finalise the national SDG indicators, SDG communications plan, 2018 SDG Voluntary National Review (VNR) and SDG Mobile Application. In 2020, the second VNR is in the process of development and data collection for all SDG indicators have been almost in final stage. 3.2.1. ≥3 partially, government officials and partners have been fully engaged in the SDG localisation process 3.2.2. ≥3- around 60% of SDG indicators have been integrated into the 8th NSEDP (2016-2020). On-going discussions have been made on how the rest of SDG indicators will be fed into the 9th and 10th NSEDPs 4.1.1- Partially achieved. Around one-third of all SDG indicators have baseline values and work is on-going to collect all data for all SDG indicators and those related to the NSEDP. SDG metadata is currently being developed. 4.1.2. On-going – but no data collected at this stage. 4.1.3. no assessment was conducted 4.2.1. The current (5th) NHDR was published in 2018. The development of the 6th NHDR has been postponed due to lack of funding. 4.2.2. two key research papers were produced and published to support the realisation of the 8th NSEDP and formulation of the 9th NSEDP. These papers include (i) Rural Development and Sustainable Poverty Reduction; and (ii) Policies supporting job creation and labour allocation into domestic industries in Lao PDR by 2025. 5.1.1. no unqualified audit report. 5 out of 8 audit recommendations were implemented. 5.1.2. no data 5.1.3. resource mobilization still not achieve the target

1.1.1. RBM resource group was formed and TOR of the consultant was developed. However, other activities were put on hold to 2020 due to the budget constraint. 1.1.2. activities were put on hold to 2020 due to the budget constraint. 1.1.3. activities on the MTEF trainings were put on hold to 2020 due to the budget constraint. 1.2.1. 1-3? The Mid-Term Review (MTR) of the 8th NSEDP (2016-2020) was finalized and it is used as a guide to the implementation of the remaining period of the 8th NSEDP and the design of the 9th NSEDP. 1.2.2. activities were put on hold to 2020 due to the budget constraint.
2.1.1. No discussion at this stage, given the schedule of the process until 2024, following the eligibility announced in 2018. 2.1.2. In progress, VDCAP progress is currently monitored and reported through quarterly VDCAP secretariat meetings and RTiM. Currently, VDCAP indicators are integrated into the ODA-MIS.Gov.La. However, some activities such as trainings on the formulation and implementation of the PBA programme and the publication of the annual Foreign Aid Implementation Report have been putting on hold because of budget limitation. 2.2.1. In progress. Feedback from both national and international partners were included in the 8th NSEDP MTR and draft initial concept/outline of the 9th NSEDP and other documents. There is a clear link between RTP and SWG mechanism by having technical and executive meetings organized. 2.2.2. In progress, the RTP secretariat is developing the RTiM follow-up matrix consisting of various discussion points/ recommendations with appropriate follow up actions linking to line ministries/SWGs.
3.1.1. In progress, key SDG materials are prepared and revised have been prepared and revised based on inputs from SDG focal points through a series of consultation meetings. Annual retreat for the National SDGs secretariat was also a platform for the discussion on the implementation and the lesson learned. 3.1.2. In progress (see above) 3.2.1. To ensure proper monitoring and reporting on SDGs implementation, DIO/MOFA has been in the process of setting up and maintaining a reliable SDG database within the department. 3.2.2. Currently at the finalisation stage of the SDG indicators and metadata.
4.1.1. In progress, the provincial statistic database (LaoInfo) system was established in five (05) provinces. 4.1.2. Currently on hold due to limited financial resources. Only trainings were conducted. 4.1.3. Currently on hold due to limited financial resources. 4.2.1. Currently on hold due to limited financial resources. 4.2.2. Partially. “Structure Transformation and Economic Diversification in Lao PDR” and two (02) Quarterly Macro-Economic Reports on development situation (such as: LDC graduation matters, partnerships and SDGs, etc) were produced. Other reports were on hold due to budget limitation.
